# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is how you can write the function using the `Date` type from the DataFrames package in Julia. 

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> Dates.year(x)*100 + Dates.month(x), df[:dt])
end
```
This function takes a dataframe `df` and creates a new column `:ym` which is the year and month concatenated together as an integer in the format "yyyymm". The `map` function applies a function to each element of a column, here it's extracting the year and month from the DateTimes.

You can test this function with some data like so:

```julia
df = DataFrame(dt = [DateTime(2021, 1, 1), DateTime(2022, 2, 29)])
add_yearmonth(df)
```
This will give you a new column `:ym` in your dataframe that contains the year and month of each date time as an integer.
